intro: Laurentia commutata, commonly known as the smoothleaf false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth on both sides. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
